column1: Les Lilas is a commune in the northern-eastern suburbs of Paris
column2: France. It is located 5.7 km (3.5 mi) from the centre of Paris.

column1: The commune of Les Lilas (literally "the lilacs") was created on 24 July 1867 by detaching a part of the territory of Romainville and merging it with a part of the territory of Pantin and a part of the territory of Bagnolet.
Les Lilas is served by Mairie des Lilas station on Paris Métro Line 11.
It is the home of the exiled royal family of Montenegro.
It is the birthplace of French actress Maïwenn Le Besco
Les Lilas is known for the hit 1958 song by Serge Gainsbourg
